P/T Sentence Text: Where fire protection and life safety systems, and systems with fire protection and life safety functions, are integrated with each other, the systems shall be tested as a whole in accordance with CAN/ULC-S1001, "Integrated Systems Testing of Fire Protection and Life Safety Systems", to verify that the systems have been properly integrated. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.3.1.1.(2)and 3.3.1.1.(3), each suite in other than business and personal services occupancies shall be separated from adjoining suites by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h. (See also Subsection 3.3.3. for care, treatment or detention occupancies, Article 3.3.4.2. for residential occupancies, and Article 3.1.8.7. for fire dampers.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences (2) and (3), each suite in other than business and personal services occupancies shall be separated from adjoining suites by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence (1) is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. is permitted to be less than 1 h for (a) the floor assembly above the floor area, or (b) the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence (1) is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. is permitted to be less than 1 h for, (a) the floor assembly above the floor area, or (b) the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.

National Sentence Text: Occupancies that are served by public corridors conforming to Sentence 3.3.1.4.(4)(b) in a building that is sprinklered throughout, are not required to be separated from one another by fire separations provided the occupancies are (a) suites of business and personal services occupancy, (b) fast food vending operations that do not provide seating for customers, (c) suites of mercantile occupancy, or (d) any combination of these occupancies.
P/T Sentence Text: Occupancies that are served by public corridors conforming to Clause 3.3.1.4.(4)(b) in a building that is sprinklered, are not required to be separated from one another by fire separations provided the occupancies are, (a) suites of business and personal services occupancy, (b) fast food vending operations that do not provide seating for customers, (c) suites of mercantile occupancy, or (d) any combination of these occupancies.

National Sentence Text: Except as otherwise stated in this Section, aisles shall be provided in conformance with the NFC.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as otherwise required by this Section, aisles shall be provided in conformance with the Fire Code made under the Fire Protection and Prevention Act, 1997.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.11.(5) and Article 3.3.1.12., a door that opens into a corridor or other facility providing access to exit from a suite or room not located within a suite shall swing on a vertical axis.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence (5) and Article 3.3.1.11., a door that opens into a corridor or other facility providing access to exit from a suite, or a room not located within a suite, shall swing on a vertical axis.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Article 3.3.1.12., a door that opens into a corridor or other facility providing access to exit from a room or suite that is used or intended for an occupant load more than 60 or for a high-hazard industrial occupancy shall swing in the direction of travel to the exit.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Article 3.3.1.11., a door that opens into a corridor or other facility providing access to exit from a room or suite shall swing in the direction of travel to the exit if the room or suite is used or intended for, an occupant load more than 60, a high hazard industrial occupancy, or a hazardous classroom in an elementary or secondary school.

National Sentence Text: Every door that divides a corridor that is not wholly contained within a suite shall swing on a vertical axis in the direction of travel to the exit.
P/T Sentence Text: Every door that divides a corridor that is not wholly contained within a suite shall swing on a vertical axis in the direction of travel to the exit where the corridor provides access to exit for, an occupant load more than 60, a high hazard industrial occupancy, a hazardous classroom in an elementary or secondary school, a Group B, Division 2 or 3 occupancy, or a retirement home.

National Sentence Text: If a pair of doors is installed in a corridor that provides access to exit in both directions, the doors shall swing in opposite directions, with the door on the right hand side swinging in the direction of travel to the exit.
P/T Sentence Text: If a pair of doors is installed in a corridor that provides access to exit in both directions, the doors shall swing in opposite directions, with the door on the right hand side swinging in the direction of travel to the exit.

National Sentence Text: Doors that serve storage suites not more than 28 m2 in area in warehousing buildings need not conform to Sentence 3.3.1.11.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Doors that serve individual storage spaces not more than 28 m2 in area in self-service storage buildings need not conform to Sentence (1).

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.3.1.12.(2) and 3.3.1.11.(5) , a sliding door provided in the locations described in Article 3.3.1.11. shall be designed and installed to swing on the vertical axis in the direction of travel to the exit when pressure is applied, and be identified as a swinging door by means of a label or decal affixed to it.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences (2) and 3.3.1.10.(5), a sliding door provided in the locations described in Article 3.3.1.10. shall, be designed and installed to swing on the vertical axis in the direction of travel to the exit when pressure is applied, and be identified as a swinging door by means of a label or decal affixed to it.

National Sentence Text: In a Group B, Division 1 occupancy, or in an impeded egress zone in other occupancies, sliding doors used in an access to exit need not conform to Sentence 3.3.1.12.(1) and Article 3.3.1.11.
P/T Sentence Text: In a Group B, Division 1 occupancy, or in an impeded egress zone in other occupancies, sliding doors used in an access to exit need not conform to Sentence (1) and Article 3.3.1.10.

National Sentence Text: Movable partitions used to separate a public corridor from an adjacent business and personal services occupancy or a mercantile occupancy need not conform to Sentence 3.3.1.12.(1) and Sentences 3.3.1.11.(1) and 3.3.1.11.(2), provided the partitions are not located in the only means of egress. (See Note A-3.3.1.12.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Movable partitions used to separate a public corridor from an adjacent business and personal services occupancy or a mercantile occupancy need not conform to Sentence (1) and Sentences 3.3.1.10.(1) and (2) provided the partitions are not located in the only means of egress. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Article 3.3.3.4., a door that opens into or is located within a public corridor or other facility that provides access to exit from a suite shall provide a clear opening of not less than 800 mm if there is only one door leaf, in a doorway with multiple leaves, have the active leaf providing a clear opening of not less than 800 mm, not open onto a step, and have a threshold not more than 13 mm higher than the surrounding finished floor surface, except where it is used to confine the spillage of flammable liquids within a service room or within a room in an industrial occupancy, or provides access to an exterior balcony, unless the balcony is required by Sentence 3.3.1.7.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Article 3.3.3.4. and Sentences 3.3.4.11.(11), 3.8.3.3.(1) and (2), a door that opens into or is located within a public corridor or other facility that provides access to exit from a suite, shall provide a clear opening of not less than 800 mm, if there is only one door leaf, shall, in a doorway with multiple leaves, have the active leaf providing a clear opening of not less than 800 mm, shall not open onto a step, and shall not have a threshold more than 13 mm higher than the floor surface except where, the threshold is used to contain spillage, or the doorway provides access to an exterior balcony, other than a balcony required by Sentence 3.3.1.7.(2).

National Sentence Text: Locking devices permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.13.(6) that are electrically operated shall be designed to operate on emergency power, and capable of manual release by security personnel.
P/T Sentence Text: Locking devices permitted by Sentence (6) that are electrically operated shall be, designed to operate on emergency power, and capable of manual release by security personnel.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (6)and (7), a door in an access to exit shall be readily openable in travelling to an exit without requiring keys, special devices or specialized knowledge of the door-opening mechanism.
P/T Sentence Text: A door in an access to exit shall be readily openable in travelling to an exit without requiring keys, special devices or specialized knowledge of the door opening mechanism, except that this requirement does not apply to a door serving a contained use area, or an impeded egress zone, provided the locking devices conform to Sentence (6).

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.13.(4), door release hardware shall comply with Sentence 3.8.3.8.(1) and the door shall be openable with not more than one releasing operation. (See also Sentence 3.8.3.6.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence (4), door release hardware shall be operable by one hand and the door shall be openable with not more than one releasing operation.

National Sentence Text: An egress door from an individual dwelling unit or from a suite of residential occupancy is permitted to be provided with additional devices that require a releasing operation additional to the main door release hardware, provided the devices are readily operable from the inside without the use of keys, special devices or specialized knowledge. (See Note A-3.3.1.13.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except in a retirement home, an egress door from an individual dwelling unit or from a suite of residential occupancy is permitted to be provided with additional devices that require a releasing operation additional to the main door release hardware, provided the devices are readily operable from the inside without the use of keys, special devices or specialized knowledge. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Door release hardware shall be installed not more than 1?200 mm above the finished floor.
P/T Sentence Text: Door release hardware shall be installed not more than 1 200 mm above the finished floor.

National Sentence Text: An egress door in an access to exit serving a contained use area or an impeded egress zone is permitted to be equipped with locking devices, provided they can be released either locally or remotely in conformance with Sentence 3.3.1.13.(8) or 3.3.1.13.(9). (See Note A-3.3.1.13.(6).)
P/T Sentence Text: A door in a means of egress serving a contained use area or an impeded egress zone is permitted to be equipped with locking devices that can be released either locally or remotely in conformance with Sentence (7) or (8). (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: A door in an access to exit is permitted to be equipped with an electromagnetic lock conforming to Sentence 3.4.6.16.(4) or 3.4.6.16.(5).
P/T Sentence Text: A door in an access to exit is permitted to be equipped with an electromagnetic locking device conforming to Sentence 3.4.6.16.(4), except that this permission does not apply to a door, (a) in an elementary or secondary school, (b) a door leading from a Group F, Division 1 occupancy, or (c) except as provided in Sentence (11), requiring a latch release device by Article 3.3.2.6.

National Sentence Text: Local locking devices permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.13.(6) shall be operable by a key from both sides of the door.
P/T Sentence Text: Local locking devices permitted by Sentence (6) shall be operable by a key from both sides of the door.

National Sentence Text: Controls for the remote release of door locking devices permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.13.(6) shall be located in an area readily available to security personnel.
P/T Sentence Text: Controls for the remote release of door locking devices permitted by Sentence (6) shall be located in an area readily available to security personnel.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence (2), Article 3.3.4.7. and Subsectin 3.3.2., ramps and stairways that do not serve as exits shall conform to the requirements for exit ramps and stairways stated in Sentence 3.4.3.2.(8) and Articles 3.4.3.4., and 3.4.6.1. to 3.4.6.9.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence (2), Article 3.3.4.7. and Subsection 3.3.2., ramps and stairways that do not serve as exits shall conform to the dimensional, guard, handrail and slip-resistance requirements for exit ramps and stairways of Sentence 3.4.3.2.(7) and Articles 3.4.3.5. and 3.4.6.1. to 3.4.6.9.

National Sentence Text: Ramps and stairways that serve service rooms, service spaces or industrial occupancies need not comply with Sentence 3.3.1.14.(1), provided they are intended only for occasional use for servicing equipment and machinery, and they do not serve as exits.
P/T Sentence Text: Ramps and stairways that do not conform to the requirements of Sentence (1) and are intended only for occasional use for servicing equipment and machinery are permitted, to serve service rooms and service spaces, and in industrial occupancies.

National Sentence Text: An exterior passageway leading to a required exit shall conform to the requirements of part 3. for exterior exit passageways.
P/T Sentence Text: An exterior passageway leading to a required exit shall conform to the requirements of Section 3.4. for exterior exit passageways.

National Article Title:
Tapered Treads in a Curved Flight 
Curved Flights in Exits
National Sentence Text: Exit stair flights shall consist solely of (a) straight flights, or (b) curved flights complying with Sentence (2).
P/T Sentence Text: Flights used as an exit shall consist solely of, straight flights, or curved flights complying with Sentence (2).

National Article Title: Tapered Treads in a Curved Flight
National Sentence Text: Flights of stairs shall consist solely of straight flights, or curved flights complying with Sentence 3.3.1.16.(2).
P/T Article Title: 3.3.1.15. Tapered Treads in a Curved Flight
P/T Sentence Text: Flights shall consist solely of, straight flights, or curved flights complying with Sentence (2).

National Article Title: Tapered Treads in a Curved Flight
National Sentence Text: Tapered treads in a curved flight that is not required as an exit shall have a minimum run of 150 mm, a run not less than 280 mm when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the handrail at the narrow end of the tread, and a riser conforming to Sentence 3.4.6.8.(2).
P/T Article Title: 3.3.1.15. Tapered Treads in a Curved Flight
P/T Sentence Text: Tapered treads in a curved flight that is not required as an exit shall have, a minimum run of 150 mm, a run not less than 280 mm when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the inside handrail, and a riser conforming to Sentence 3.4.6.8.(2).

National Article Title: Tapered Treads in a Curved Flight
National Sentence Text: Tapered treads shall have a consistent angle and uniform run and rise dimensions in accordance with the construction tolerances stipulated in Article 3.4.6.8. when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the handrail at the narrow end of the tread.
P/T Article Title: 3.3.1.15. Tapered Treads in a Curved Flight
P/T Sentence Text: Tapered treads shall have a consistent angle and uniform run and rise dimensions in accordance with the construction tolerances described in Article 3.4.6.8. when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the inside handrail.

National Article Title: Tapered Treads in a Curved Flight
National Sentence Text: All tapered treads within a flight shall turn in the same direction.
P/T Article Title: 3.3.1.15. Tapered Treads in a Curved Flight
P/T Sentence Text: All tapered treads within a flight shall turn in the same direction.

National Sentence Text: The capacity of an access to exit shall be based on the occupant load of the portion of the floor area served.
P/T Sentence Text: The capacity of an access to exit shall be based on the occupant load of the portionof the floor area served.

National Sentence Text: In an access to exit the required width of ramps with a slope not more than 1 in 8, doorways, and corridors shall be based on not less than 6.1 mm per person.
P/T Sentence Text: In an access to exit the required width of ramps with a slope not more than 1 in 8, doorways, and corridors shall be based on not less than 6.1 mm per person.

National Sentence Text: In an access to exit the required width of a ramp with a slope more than 1 in 8 shall be based on not less than 9.2 mm per person.
P/T Sentence Text: In an access to exit the required width of a ramp with a slope more than 1 in 8 shall be based on not less than 9.2 mm per person.

National Sentence Text: In an access to exit from a floor area used or intended to be used for patients in a Group B, Division 2 occupancy or residents in a Group B, Division 3 occupancy, the required width of corridors, doorways, and ramps shall be based on not less than 18.4 mm per person.
P/T Sentence Text: In an access to exit from a floor area used or intended to be used for patients or residents in a Group B, Division 2 or Division 3 occupancy, the required width of corridors, doorways, and ramps shall be based on not less than 18.4 mm per person.

National Sentence Text: The capacity of stairs in an access to exit shall conform to the requirements for stairs in Sentences 3.4.3.2.(1) to 3.4.3.2.(3).
P/T Sentence Text: The capacity of stairs in an access to exit shall conform to the requirements for stairs in Sentences 3.4.3.2.(1) to (3).

National Sentence Text: In a building that is not sprinklered throughout in accordance with Sentence 3.2.5.12.(1), an access to exit that is part of the principal entrance serving a dance hall or a licensed beverage establishment with an occupant load more than 250 shall provide at least one half of the required exit width.
P/T Sentence Text: In a building that is not sprinklered in accordance with Sentence 3.2.5.13.(1), an access to exit that is part of the principal entrance serving a dance hall or a licensed beverage establishment with an occupant load more than 250 shall be at least one-half of the required exit width.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.1.18.(5) and Article 3.3.2.9., a guard not less than 1?070 mm high shall be provided around any roof to which access is provided for purposes other than maintenance, at openings into smoke shafts referred to in part 3. that are less than 1?070 mm above the floor, and at each raised floor, mezzanine, balcony, gallery, interior or exterior vehicular ramp, and at other locations where (see Note A-9.8.8.1.) the difference in elevation is more than 600 mm between the walking surface and the adjacent surface, or the adjacent surface within 1.2 m of the walking surface has a slope of more than 1 in 2.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (6) and Articles 3.3.2.8. and 3.3.4.7., a guard not less than 1 070 mm high shall be provided, around each roof to which access is provided for other than maintenance, at openings into smoke shafts referred to in Subsection 3.2.6. that are less than 1 070 mm above the floor, and at each raised floor, mezzanine, balcony, gallery, interior or exterior vehicular ramp, and at other locations where, the difference in level is more than 600 mm between the walking surface and the adjacent surface, or the adjacent surface within 1 200 mm of the walking surface has a slope of more than 1 in 2 away from the walking surface.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (3) and 3.3.2.9.(4) and Articles 3.3.4.7. and 3.3.5.10., openings through guards shall be of a size that prevents the passage of a spherical object whose diameter is more than 100 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (3) and Sentence 3.3.2.8.(4), openings through any guard that is required by Sentence (1) shall be of a size that will prevent the passage of a sphere having a diameter more than 100 mm unless it can be shown that the location and size of openings that exceed this limit do not represent a hazard.

National Sentence Text: Openings through guards other than those required by Sentence 3.3.1.18.(1) that serve occupancies other than industrial occupancies shall be of a size that prevents the passage of a spherical object whose diameter is 100 mm, or permits the passage of a spherical object whose diameter is 200 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Openings through any guard that is not required by Sentence (1) and that serves a building of other than industrial occupancy, shall be of a size that, (a) will prevent the passage of a sphere having a diameter more than 100 mm, or (b) will permit the passage of a sphere having a diameter more than 200 mm unless it can be shown that the location and size of openings that exceed these limits do not represent a hazard.

National Sentence Text: Except for guards conforming to Article 3.3.5.10., guards that protect a level located more than one storey or 4.2 m above the adjacent level shall be designed so that no member, attachment or opening located between 140 mm and 900 mm above the level protected by the guard facilitates climbing. (See Note A-9.8.8.6.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Unless it can be shown that the location and size of openings do not present a hazard, a guard shall be designed so that no member, attachment or opening located between 140 mm and 900 mm above the level protected by the guard will facilitate climbing.

National Sentence Text: Sentence 3.3.1.18.(1) does not apply to the front edges of stages, to loading docks, or where access is provided for maintenance purposes only.
P/T Sentence Text: Sentence (1) does not apply, to the front edges of stages, to loading docks, to floor pits in repair garages, or where access is provided for maintenance purposes only.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.19.(5), a glass or transparent door shall be designed and constructed so that the existence and position of the door is readily apparent, by attaching visually contrasting hardware, bars or other permanent fixtures to it.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for dwelling units and as permitted by Sentence (4), a glass or transparent door shall be designed and constructed so that the existence and position of the door is readily apparent, by attaching visually contrasting hardware, bars or other permanent fixtures to it.

National Sentence Text: The visibility of fully glazed transparent doors, sidelights and panels shall be enhanced through the inclusion of mullions, markings or other elements that (a) are visually contrasting, (b) are at least 50 mm high, (c) extend the full width of the door, sidelight or panel, and (d) are located between 1 350 mm and 1 500 mm above the floor.
P/T Sentence Text: (1.1) Fully glazed transparent doors, and fully glazed transparent sidelights and panels with widths greater than 300 mm, shall be marked in conformance with Sentence 3.8.3.3.(15).

National Sentence Text: The visibility of fully glazed transparent doors, sidelights and panels shall be enhanced through the inclusion of mullions, markings or other elements that (a) are visually contrasting, (b) are at least 50mm high, (c) extend the full width of the door, sidelight or panel, and (d) are located between 1 350 mm and 1 500 mm above the floor.
P/T Sentence Text: A door in a barrier-free path of travel consisting of a sheet of glass shall be marked with a continuous opaque strip that, (a)	shall be colour and brightness contrasted to the background of the door, (b) shall be at least 50 mm wide, (c) shall be located across the width of the door at a height of 1 350 mm to 1 500 mm above the finished floor, and (d) may incorporate a logo or symbol provided such logo or symbol does not diminish, (i) the opacity of the strip, (ii) the width of the strip, (iii) the colour and brightness contrast of the strip to the background of the door, and (iv) the continuity of the strip across the width of the door.

National Sentence Text: A glass door shall be constructed of laminated or tempered safety glass conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.1-M90 Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass or wired glass conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.11-M90 Wired Safety Glass
P/T Sentence Text: A glass door shall be constructed of, laminated or tempered safety glass conforming to CAN/CGSB-12.1-M, "Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass", or wired glass conforming to CAN/CGSB-12.11-M, "Wired Safety Glass".

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.19.(5), transparent panels used in an access to exit that, because of their physical configuration or design, could be mistaken as a means of egress shall be made inaccessible by barriers or railings.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence (4), transparent panels used in an access to exit that, because of their physical configuration or design, could be mistaken as a means of egress shall be made inaccessible by barriers or railings.

National Sentence Text: Sliding glass partitions that separate a public corridor from an adjacent occupancy and that are open during normal working hours need not conform to Sentences 3.3.1.19.(1) and 3.3.1.19.(4), provided the partitions are suitably marked in conformance with Sentence 3.3.1.19.(2) to indicate their existence and position.
P/T Sentence Text: Sliding glass partitions that separate a public corridor from an adjacent occupancy and that are intended to be open during normal working hours need not conform to Sentences (1) and (3), provided the partitions are marked in conformance with Sentence 3.8.3.3.(15).

National Sentence Text: Where vision glass is provided in doors or transparent sidelights, the lowest edge of the glass shall be no higher than 900 mm above floor level.
P/T Sentence Text: (4.1) Glass in a vision panel in a door or in a transparent sidelight shall conform to Sentence 3.8.3.3.(14).

National Sentence Text: Glass in doors and in sidelights that could be mistaken for doors, within or at the entrances to dwelling units and in public areas, shall conform to the requirements of Article 9.6.1.4.
P/T Sentence Text: Glass in doors and glass sidelights that could be mistaken for doors, within or at the entrances to dwelling units and in public areas, shall conform to the requirements of Article 9.6.1.4.

National Sentence Text: A window in a public area that extends to less than 1?000 mm above the floor and is located above the second storey in a building of residential occupancy, shall be protected by a barrier or railing to not less than 1?070 mm above the floor, or the window shall be non-openable and designed to withstand the lateral design loads for balcony guards required by Article 4.1.5.14.
P/T Sentence Text: A window in a public area that extends to less than 1 070 mm above the floor and is located above the second storey in a building of residential occupancy, shall be protected by a barrier or railing from the floor to not less than 1 070 mm above the floor, or the window shall be non-openable and designed to withstand the lateral design loads for balcony guards required by Article 4.1.5.14.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Subsections 3.3.5. and 3.3.6., the storage, handling and use of hazardous substances shall be in conformance with (a) provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws, or (b) in the absence of the regulations or bylaws referred to in Clause (a), the NFC. (See Note A-3.3.1.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Subsection 3.3.6., the storage, handling and use of the hazardous substances shall be in conformance with, (a) the Fire Code made under the Fire Protection and Prevention Act, 1997, or (b) the CCBFC NRCC 56192, National Fire Code of Canada, in the absence of regulations referred to in Clause (a).

National Sentence Text:
Systems for the ventilation of cooking equipment that is not within a dwelling unit and is used in processes producing grease-laden vapours shall be designed and installed in conformance with Articles 3.6.3.5., 6.3.1.7.and 6.9.1.3.(See
Note A-3.3.1.2.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Systems for the ventilation of cooking equipment that is not within a dwelling unit and is used in processes producing grease-laden vapours shall be designed and installed in conformance with Articles 3.6.3.5 and 6.2.2.6.

National Sentence Text: A fuel-fired appliance shall not be installed in a corridor serving as an access to exit.
P/T Sentence Text: A fuel-fired appliance shall not be installed in a corridor serving as an access to exit.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.1.20.(2), an exhaust ventilation system designed in conformance with the appropriate requirements of part 6. shall be provided in a building or part of a building in which dust, fumes, gases, vapour or other impurities or contaminants have the potential to create a fire or explosion hazard. (See also Article 4.2.4.13.)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), an exhaust ventilation system designed in conformance with the appropriate requirements of Part 6 shall be provided in a building or part of a building in which dust, fumes, gases, vapour or other impurities or contaminants have the potential to create a fire or explosion hazard.

National Sentence Text: Where a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating is penetrated by a ventilation system required by Sentence 3.3.1.20.(1) for power-ventilated enclosures in laboratories, the ducts shall be (a) continuously enclosed from the first penetrated fire separation to any subsequent fire separations or concealed spaces and all the way through to the outdoors so that the highest fire-resistance rating of all the penetrated fire separations is maintained, and (b) exempted from the requirement to be equipped with a fire damper, smoke damper and fire/smoke damper as stated in Article 3.1.8.7.
P/T Sentence Text: Ducts described in Sentence (2) need not be equipped with a fire damper, a smoke damper or a combination smoke and fire damper.

National Sentence Text: Where a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating is penetrated by a ventilation system required by Sentence 3.3.1.20.(1) for power-ventilated enclosures in laboratories, the ducts shall be (a) continuously enclosed from the first penetrated fire separation to any subsequent fire separations or concealed spaces and all the way through to the outdoors so that the highest fire-resistance rating of all the penetrated fire separations is maintained, and (b) exempted from the requirement to be equipped with a fire damper, smoke damper and fire/smoke damper as stated in Article 3.1.8.7.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating is penetrated by a ventilation system required by Sentence (1) for power-ventilated enclosures in laboratories, the ducts shall be continuously enclosed from the first penetrated fire separation to any subsequent fire separations or concealed spaces and to the outdoors so that the highest fire-resistance rating of all the penetrated fire separations is maintained.

National Sentence Text: Explosion relief devices, vents or other protective measures conforming to Subsection 6.3.1. and Article 6.9.1.2. shall be provided for a space in which substances or conditions that have the potential to create an explosion hazard are present as a result of the principal use of a building.
P/T Sentence Text: Explosion relief devices, vents or other protective measures conforming to Subsection 6.2.2. shall be provided for a space in which substances or conditions that have the potential to create an explosion hazard are present as a result of the principal use of a building.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.3.1.21.(2) and 3.3.1.21.(3), a room or space within a floor area for the storage of janitorial supplies shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences (2) and (3), a room or space within a floor area for the storage of janitorial supplies shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.1.1.(1) is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by part 3. is permitted to be less than 1 h for the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence (1) is permitted to be not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. is permitted to be less than 1 h for, the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.

National Sentence Text: The fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.1.21.(1) is not required to have a fire-resistance rating if the floor area in which the room or space is located is sprinklered throughout.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire separation required by Sentence (1) is not required to have a fire-resistance rating if the floor area in which the room or space is located is sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.3.1.22.(2) and 3.3.1.22.(3), in a building of residential occupancy, a laundry room in a floor area that is not within a dwelling unit shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences (2) and (3), in a building of residential occupancy, a laundry room in a floor area that is not within a dwelling unit shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

National Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.1.1.(1) is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by part 3. is permitted to be less than 1 h for (a) the floor assembly above the floor area, or (b) the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence (1) is permitted to be not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. is permitted to be less than 1 h for, the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.

National Sentence Text: The fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.1.22.(1) is not required to have a fire-resistance rating if the floor area in which the laundry room is located is sprinklered throughout.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire separation required by Sentence (1) is not required to have a fire-resistance rating if the floor area in which the laundry room is located is sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: No obstruction shall be permitted in any occupancy that would restrict the width of a normal means of egress from any part of a floor area to less than 750 mm unless an alternative means of egress is provided adjacent to, accessible from, and plainly visible from the obstructed means of egress. (See Note A-3.3.1.23.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: No obstruction shall be permitted in any occupancy that would restrict the width of a normal means of egress from any part of a floor area to less than 750 mm unless an unobstructed alternative means of egress is provided adjacent to, accessible from, and plainly visible from the obstructed means of egress. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Illuminated signs conforming to Sentences 3.4.5.1.(2) and 3.4.5.1.(6) shall be provided to indicate the direction to egress points in a service space referred to in Sentence 3.2.1.1.(8).
P/T Sentence Text: Illuminated signs conforming to Sentence 3.4.5.1.(2) or (7) shall be provided to indicate the direction to egress points in a service space referred to in Sentence 3.2.1.1.(9).

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.1.25.(2), welding and cutting operations shall be carried out in a room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, or protected by an automatic fire extinguishing system.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), welding and cutting operations shall be located in a room, separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, or protected by an automatic fire extinguishing system.

National Sentence Text: Sentence 3.3.1.25.(1) shall not apply to industrial occupancies where the welding and cutting operations do not present a fire or explosion hazard to adjacent areas.
P/T Sentence Text: Sentence (1) does not apply to an industrial occupancy where the welding and cutting operations do not present a fire or explosion hazard to adjacent areas.

National Sentence Text: Access to exit within floor areas shall conform to Subsections 3.3.2. to 3.3.5.,in addition to the requirements of this Subsection.
P/T Sentence Text: Access to exit within floor areas shall conform to Subsections 3.3.2. to 3.3.6., in addition to the requirements of this Subsection.

National Sentence Text: If a podium, terrace, platform or contained open space is provided, egress requirements shall conform to the appropriate requirements of Sentence 3.3.1.5.(1) for rooms and suites.
P/T Sentence Text: If a podium, terrace, platform or contained open space is provided, egress requirements shall conform to the appropriate requirements of Sentence 3.3.1.5.(1) for rooms and suites.

National Sentence Text: Means of egress shall be provided from every roof which is intended for occupancy, and from every podium, terrace, platform or contained open space.
P/T Sentence Text: Means of egress shall be provided from every roof that is intended for occupancy, and from every podium, terrace, platform or contained open space.

National Sentence Text: At least two separate means of egress shall be provided from a roof, used or intended for an occupant load more than 60, to stairs designed in conformance with the requirements regarding exit stairs stated in Section 3.4.
P/T Sentence Text: At least two separate means of egress shall be provided from a roof, used or intended for an occupant load more than 60, to stairs designed in conformance with the exit stair requirements of Section 3.4.

National Sentence Text: A rooftop enclosure shall be provided with an access to exit that leads to an exit at the roof level, or on the storey immediately below the roof.
P/T Sentence Text: A rooftop enclosure shall be provided with an access to exit that leads to an exit, at the roof level, or on the storey immediately below the roof.

National Sentence Text: A rooftop enclosure which is more than 200 m2 in area shall be provided with at least 2 means of egress.
P/T Sentence Text: A rooftop enclosure that is more than 200 m2 in area shall be provided with at least two means of egress.

National Sentence Text: Two points of egress shall be provided for a service space referred to in Sentence 3.2.1.1.(8) if (a) the area is more than 200 m2 , or (b) the travel distance measured from any point in the service space to a point of egress is more than 25 m.
P/T Sentence Text: Two points of egress shall be provided for a service space referred to in Sentence 3.2.1.1.(9) if, (a) the area is more than 200 m2, or (b) the travel distance measured from any point in the service space to a point of egress is more than 25 m.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.3.4.4.(5) and 3.3.4.4.(6), each suite in a floor area that contains more than one suite shall have (a) an exterior exit doorway, or (b) a doorway (i) into a public corridor, or (ii) to an exterior passageway.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.3.4.4.(8) and permitted by Sentences 3.3.4.4.(5) and (6), each suite in a floor area that contains more than one suite shall have, (a) an exterior exit doorway, or (b) a doorway, (i) into a public corridor, or (ii) to an exterior passageway.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by this Section and by Sentence 3.4.2.1.(2), at the point where a doorway referred to in Sentence (8) opens onto a public corridor or exterior passageway, it shall be possible to go in opposite directions to each of 2 separate exits.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by this Section and by Sentence 3.4.2.1.(2), at the point where a doorway referred to in Sentence (8) opens onto a public corridor or exterior passageway, it shall be possible to go in opposite directions to each of two separate exits.

National Sentence Text: Except as otherwise required by this Part or as permitted by Sentence (4), a public corridor shall be separated from the remainder of the storey by a fire separation.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as otherwise required by this Part or as permitted by Sentence (4), a public corridor shall be separated from the remainder of the storey by a fire separation. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence (3) and Clauses (4)(a) and (4)(b), the fire separation between a public corridor and the remainder of the storey shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence (3) and Clauses (4)(a) and (b), the fire separation between a public corridor and the remainder of the storey shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min.

National Sentence Text: If a storey is sprinklered throughout, no fire-resistance rating is required for a fire separation between a public corridor and the remainder of the storey, provided the corridor does not serve a care, treatment or detention occupancy or a residential occupancy. (See Note A-3.1.8.1.(1)(b).)
P/T Sentence Text: If a storey is sprinklered, no fire-resistance rating is required for a fire separation between a public corridor and the remainder of the storey provided the corridor does not serve a care, care and treatment, detention or residential occupancy.

National Sentence Text: No fire separation is required in a sprinklered floor area between a public corridor and (a) except as required by Sentences 3.3.3.5.(8) and 3.3.4.2.(1), and notwithstanding Sentence 3.4.2.4.(2), the remainder of a storey, provided the travel distance from any part of the floor area to an exit is not more than 45 m, (b) a room or a suite, provided the public corridor complies with Sentence 3.3.1.9.(6) and Sentence 3.4.2.5.(1), or (c) a space containing plumbing fixtures required by Subsection 3.7.2., provided the space and the public corridor are separated from the remainder of the storey by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required between the public corridor and the remainder of the storey.
P/T Sentence Text: No fire separation is required in a sprinklered floor area between a public corridor and, (a) except as required by Sentences 3.3.3.5.(9) and 3.3.4.2.(1) and notwithstanding Sentences 3.4.2.4.(2), the remainder of a storey provided the travel distance from any part of the floor area to an exit is not more than 45 m., (b) a room or suite provided the public corridor complies with Sentence 3.3.1.9.(6) and Clause 3.4.2.5.(1)(d), or (c) a space containing plumbing fixtures required by Subsection 3.7.4. provided the space and the public corridor are separated from the remainder of the storey by a fire separation that has a fire-resistance rating not less than that required between the public corridor and the remainder of the storey.

National Sentence Text: Except for dwelling units, a minimum of 2 egress doorways located so that one doorway could provide egress from the room or suite as required by Article 3.3.1.3. if the other doorway becomes inaccessible to the occupants due to a fire which originates in the room or suite, shall be provided for every room and every suite (a) that is used for a high-hazard industrial occupancy and whose area is more than 15 m2 , (b) intended for an occupant load more than 60, (c) in a floor area that is not sprinklered throughout, and (i) the area of a room or suite is more than the value in Table 3.3.1.5.-A, or (ii) the travel distance within the room or suite to the nearest egress doorway is more than the value in Table 3.3.1.5.-A, or (d) in a floor area that is sprinklered throughout and does not contain a high-hazard industrial occupancy and (i) the travel distance to an egress doorway is more than 25 m, or (ii) the area of the room or suite is more than the value in Table 3.3.1.5.-B.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for dwelling units, a minimum of two egress doorways located so that one doorway could provide egress from the room or suite as required by Article 3.3.1.3. if the other doorway becomes inaccessible to the occupants due to a fire that originates in the room or suite, shall be provided for every room and every suite, (a) whose area is more than 15 m2 and is used for, (i) a high hazard industrial occupancy, or (ii) a hazardous room, (b) intended for an occupant load more than 60, (c) in a floor area that is not sprinklered if, (i) the area of a room or suite is more than the value in Table 3.3.1.5.A., or (ii) the travel distance within the room or suite to the nearest egress doorway, is more than the value in Table 3.3.1.5.A., (d) in a floor area that is sprinklered and does not contain a high hazard industrial occupancy if, (i) the travel distance to an egress doorway is more than 25 m, or (ii) the area of the room or suite is more than the value in Table 3.3.1.5.B., or (e) where the area of the room is more than 100 m2 and it is a hazardous classroom in elementary or secondary school.

National Sentence Text: Where 2 egress doorways are required by Sentence 3.3.1.5.(1), they shall be placed at a distance from one another equal to or greater than one third of the maximum overall diagonal dimension of the area to be served, measured as the shortest distance that smoke would have to travel between the nearest required egress doors.
P/T Sentence Text: Where two egress doorways are required by Sentence (1), they shall be placed at a distance from one another equal to or greater than one-third of the maximum overall diagonal dimension of the room or suite to be served, measured as the shortest distance that smoke would have to travel between the nearest required egress doors.

National Sentence Text: If more than one egress doorway is required from a room or suite referred to in Article 3.3.1.5., the travel distance within the room or suite to the nearest egress doorway shall not exceed the maximum travel distances specified in Clauses 3.4.2.5.(1) , 3.4.2.5.(1) , 3.4.2.5.(1) and 3.4.2.5.(1) for exits.
P/T Sentence Text: If more than one egress doorway is required from a room or suite referred to in Article 3.3.1.5., the travel distance within the room or suite to the nearest egress doorway shall not exceed the maximum travel distances specified in Clauses 3.4.2.5.(1)(a), (b), (c) and (f) for exits.

National Article Title: Protection on Floor Areas with a Barrier-Free Path of Travel
National Sentence Text: Every floor area above or below the first storey that is not sprinklered throughout and that has a barrier-free path of travel shall (a) be served by an elevator (i) conforming to Sentences 3.2.6.5.(4) to (6), (ii) protected against fire in conformance with Clauses 3.2.6.5.(3)(b) or (c), and (iii) in a building over 3 storeys in building height, protected against smoke movement so that the hoistway will not contain more than 1% by volume of contaminated air from a fire floor during a period of 2 h after the start of a fire, assuming an outdoor temperature equal to the January design temperature on a 2.5% basis determined in conformance with Subsection 1.1.3., b) be divided into at least 2 zones by fire separations conforming to Sentences (2), (3) and 3.1.8.5.(6) so that (see Note A-3.3.1.7.(1)(b)) (i) persons with physical disabilities can be accommodated in each zone, and (ii) the travel distance from any point in one zone to a doorway leading to another zone shall be not more than the value for travel distance permitted by Sentence 3.4.2.5.(1) for the occupancy classification of the zone, (c) in the case of residential occupancies, be provided with balconies conforming to Sentence (4), except on the storey containing the barrier-free entrance required by Article 3.8.2.2., (d) have an exterior exit at ground level, or (e) have a ramp leading to ground level. (See Note A-3.3.1.7.(1).)
P/T Article Title: 3.3.1.7. Protection on Floor Areas with a Barrier-Free Path
P/T Sentence Text: In residential occupancies, the requirements of Sentence (1) are waived if a balcony conforming to Sentence (7) is provided for each suite, except for suites on the storey containing the barrier-free entrance described in Article 3.8.1.2.

National Article Title: Protection on Floor Areas with a Barrier-Free Path of Travel
National Sentence Text: Every floor area above or below the first storey that is not sprinklered throughout and that has a barrier-free path of travel shall (a) be served by an elevator (i) conforming to Sentences 3.2.6.5.(4) to (6), (ii) protected against fire in conformance with Clauses 3.2.6.5.(3)(b) or (c), and (iii) in a building over 3 storeys in building height, protected against smoke movement so that the hoistway will not contain more than 1% by volume of contaminated air from a fire floor during a period of 2 h after the start of a fire, assuming an outdoor temperature equal to the January design temperature on a 2.5% basis determined in conformance with Subsection 1.1.3., b) be divided into at least 2 zones by fire separations conforming to Sentences (2), (3) and 3.1.8.5.(6) so that (see Note A-3.3.1.7.(1)(b)) (i) persons with physical disabilities can be accommodated in each zone, and (ii) the travel distance from any point in one zone to a doorway leading to another zone shall be not more than the value for travel distance permitted by Sentence 3.4.2.5.(1) for the occupancy classification of the zone, (c) in the case of residential occupancies, be provided with balconies conforming to Sentence (4), except on the storey containing the barrier-free entrance required by Article 3.8.2.2., (d) have an exterior exit at ground level, or (e) have a ramp leading to ground level. (See Note A-3.3.1.7.(1).)
P/T Article Title: 3.3.1.7. Protection on Floor Areas with a Barrier-Free Path
P/T Sentence Text: The requirements of Sentences (1) and (2) are waived when the building is sprinklered.

National Article Title: Protection on Floor Areas with a Barrier-Free Path of Travel
National Sentence Text: Every floor area above or below the first storey that is not sprinklered throughout and that has a barrier-free path of travel shall (a) be served by an elevator (i) conforming to Sentences 3.2.6.5.(4) to 3.2.6.5.(6), (ii) protected against fire in conformance with Clauses 3.2.6.5.(3)(b) or (c), and (iii) in a building over 3 storeys in building height, protected against smoke movement so that the hoistway will not contain more than 1% by volume of contaminated air from a fire floor during a period of 2 h after the start of a fire, assuming an outdoor temperature equal to the January design temperature on a 2.5% basis determined in conformance with Subsection 1.1.3, (b) be divided into at least 2 zones by fire separations conforming to Sentences 3.3.1.7.(2) , 3.3.1.7.(3) and 3.1.8.5.(6) so that (see Note A-3.3.1.7.(1)(b)) (i) persons with physical disabilities can be accommodated in each zone, and (ii) the travel distance from any point in one zone to a doorway leading to another zone shall be not more than the value for travel distance permitted by Sentence 3.4.2.5.(1) for the occupancy classification of the zone, (c) in the case of residential occupancies, be provided with balconies conforming to Sentence 3.3.1.7.(4), except on the storey containing the barrier-free entrance required by Article 3.8.2.2., (d) have an exterior exit at ground level, or (e) have a ramp leading to ground level.
P/T Article Title: 3.3.1.7. Protection on Floor Areas with a Barrier-Free Path
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), every floor area above or below the first storey that has a barrier-free path of travel shall, (a)  be served by an elevator, (i) conforming to Sentences 3.2.6.5.(4) to (6), (ii) protected against fire in conformance with Clause 3.2.6.5.(3)(b) or (c), and (iii) in a building over 3 storeys in building height, protected against smoke movement so that the hoistway will not contain more than 1% by volume of contaminated air from a fire floor during a period of 2 h after the start of a fire, assuming an outdoor temperature equal to the January design temperature on a 2.5% basis determined in conformance with MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-1, "Climatic and Seismic Data", or (b)  be divided into at least two zones by fire separations conforming to Sentences (4) and (5) and 3.1.8.5.(6) so that, (See Appendix A.) (i) persons with physical disabilities can be accommodated in each zone, (ii)  the travel distance from any point in one zone to a doorway leading to another zone shall be not more than the value for travel distance permitted by Sentence 3.4.2.5.(1) for the occupancy classification of the zone, and (iii) a barrier-free path of travel is provided to an exit.

National Article Title: Protection on Floor Areas with a Barrier-Free Path of Travel
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence (3), the fire separations referred to in Clause (1)(b) shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
P/T Article Title: 3.3.1.7. Protection on Floor Areas with a Barrier-Free Path
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence (5), the fire separations referred to in Clause (1)(b) shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

National Article Title: Protection on Floor Areas with a Barrier-Free Path of Travel
National Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separations referred to in Clause (1)(b) is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. is permitted to be less than 1 h for (a) the floor assembly above the floor area, or (b) the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.
P/T Article Title: 3.3.1.7. Protection on Floor Areas with a Barrier-Free Path
P/T Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separations referred to in Clause (1)(b) is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. is permitted to be less than 1 h for, the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.

National Article Title: Protection on Floor Areas with a Barrier-Free Path of Travel
National Sentence Text:
A balcony required by Clause (1)(c) shall (a) have direct barrier-free access from the suite or floor area (b) be not less than 1.5 m deep from the outside face of the exterior wall to the inside edge of the balcony, and (c) provide not less than 1.5 m2 of balcony space for each non-ambulatory
occupant and 0.5 m2 for each ambulatory occupant.
P/T Article Title: 3.3.1.7. Protection on Floor Areas with a Barrier-Free Path
P/T Sentence Text: A balcony required by Sentence (2) shall, (a) be provided with a door way having a clear width of not less that 800 mm when the door is in the open position, (b) have no projection above the walking surface more than 13 mm, (c) be not less than 1.5 m deep from the outside face of the exterior wall to the inside edge of the balcony, and (d) provide not less than 0.5 m2 for each occupant of the suite.

National Sentence Text: Except within the floor area of a storage garage, the minimum headroom clearance in every access to exit shall conform to the requirements of Article 3.4.3.4. for exits. (See also Sentence 3.3.5.4.(5).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except within the floor area of a storage garage, the minimum headroom clearance in every access to exit shall conform to the requirements of Article 3.4.3.5. for exits.

National Sentence Text: The minimum width of a public corridor shall be 1?100 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The minimum width of a public corridor shall be 1 100 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentence 3.3.3.3.(3), the minimum unobstructed width of a corridor used by the public or a corridor serving classrooms or patients sleeping rooms shall be 1 100 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required by Sentences 3.3.3.3.(2) and (3), the minimum unobstructed width shall be 1 100 mm for every, (a) corridor used by the public, (b) corridor serving classrooms, and (c) corridor in a Group B, Division 2 or 3 occupancy where the corridor (i) serves a service room, (ii) serves an administrative area, (iii) will not be used by non-ambulatory outpatients, or (iv) will not be used by non-ambulatory residents.

National Sentence Text: against smoke movement so that the hoistway will not
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence (4), obstructions located within 1 980 mm of the floor shall not project more than 100 mm horizontally in a manner that would create a hazard for a person with a visual disability traveling adjacent to the walls in, an exit passageway, a public corridor, a corridor used by the public, a corridor serving classrooms, or a corridor serving patientsâ€™ or residentsâ€™ sleeping rooms in a Group B, Division 2 or Division 3 occupancy.

National Sentence Text: The horizontal projection of an obstruction referred to in Sentence (3) is permitted to be more than 100 mm provided the clearance between the obstruction and the floor is less than 680 mm.(See Note A-3.3.1.9.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: The horizontal projection of an obstruction referred to in Sentence (3) is permitted to be more than 100 mm provided the clearance between the obstruction and the floor is less than 680 mm. (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: If a corridor contains an occupancy, the occupancy shall not reduce the unobstructed width of the corridor to less than its required width.
P/T Sentence Text: If a corridor contains an occupancy, the occupancy shall not reduce the unobstructed width of the corridor to less than its required width.

National Sentence Text: If a public corridor conforming to Clause 3.4.2.5.(1)(d) contains an occupancy, (a) the occupancy shall be located so that for pedestrian travel there is an unobstructed width not less than 3 m at all times adjacent and parallel to all rooms and suites that front onto the public corridor, and (b) the combined area of all occupancies in the public corridor shall be not more than 15% of the area of the public corridor.
P/T Sentence Text: If a public corridor conforming to Clause 3.4.2.5.(1)(d) contains an occupancy, the occupancy shall be located so that for pedestrian travel there is an unobstructed width not less than 3 m at all times adjacent and parallel to all rooms and suites that front onto the public corridor, and the combined area of all occupancies in the public corridor shall be not more than 15% of the area of the public corridor.

National Sentence Text: Except for a dead-end corridor that is entirely within a suite or as permitted by Sentences 3.3.3.3.(1) and 3.3.4.4.(6), a dead-end corridor is permitted provided it is not more than 6 m long.
P/T Sentence Text: A dead end public corridor is permitted in a business and personal services occupancy where, the dead end corridor, serves an occupant load of not more than 30 persons, is not more than 9 m long, and is provided with doors having self-closing devices, or there is a second and separate egress doorway from each room or suite not leading into a dead end corridor.

National Sentence Text: Except for a dead-end corridor that is entirely within a suite or as permitted by Sentences 3.3.3.3.(1) and 3.3.4.4.(6), a dead-end corridor is permitted provided it is not more than 6 m long.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.3.3.(1), a dead end corridor shall conform to Sentences (8) to (14).

National Sentence Text: Except for a dead-end corridor that is entirely within a suite or as permitted by Sentences 3.3.3.3.(1) and 3.3.4.4.(6), a dead-end corridor is permitted provided it is not more than 6 m long.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.4.11.(10) and except for corridors served by a single exit as described in Sentence 3.3.4.4.(6), a dead end public corridor is permitted in a residential occupancy provided it is not more than 6 m long.

National Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to assembly occupancies and to outdoor places of assembly.
P/T Sentence Text: This Subsection applies to assembly occupancies and to outdoor places of assembly.

National Sentence Text: Handrails shall be provided in aisles with steps in conformance with Table 3.3.2.10.
P/T Article Title: 3.3.2.8A. Handrails in Aisles with Steps (See Appendix A.)
P/T Sentence Text: Handrails shall be provided in aisles with steps in conformance with Table 3.3.2.8A.

National Sentence Text: Handrails installed along aisle centre lines as required by Table 3.3.2.10. shall (a) comply with Sentences 3.4.6.5.(5) to 3.4.6.5.(7) and 3.4.6.5.(14), (b) have gaps not less than 560 mm and not more than 915 mm wide, measured horizontally, at intervals not exceeding five rows, (c) comply with Sentence 3.4.6.5.(11) at terminations and required gaps, and (d) have an intermediate rail located 305 mm below the principal handrail.
P/T Article Title: 3.3.2.8A. Handrails in Aisles with Steps (See Appendix A.)
P/T Sentence Text: Handrails installed along aisle centre lines as required by Table 3.3.2.8A. shall, (a) comply with Sentences 3.4.6.5.(3) to (5), (7) and (12), (b) have gaps not less than 560 mm and not more than 915 mm wide, measured horizontally, at intervals not exceeding five rows of seats, (c) comply with Sentence 3.4.6.5.(11) at terminations and required gaps, and (d)  have an intermediate rail located 305 mm below the principal handrail.

National Sentence Text: A Group A, Division 4 occupancy and each tier or balcony that has a capacity of more than 1?000 persons shall have not less than 3 separate exits , or 4?000 persons shall have not less than 4 separate exits .
P/T Sentence Text: A Group A, Division 4 occupancy and each tier or balcony that has a capacity of more than, 1 000 persons shall have no fewer than three separate exits, or 4 000 persons shall have no fewer than four separate exits.

National Sentence Text: In a Group A, Division 4 occupancy, every seat shall be located so that the travel distance is not more than 45 m measured along the path of travel from the seat to the ground, an exit, an opening to a passageway leading from the seating area, or a portal, a vomitory or any other opening through the seating deck structure.
P/T Article Title: 3.3.2.8A.  Handrails in Aisles with Steps  (See Appendix A.)
P/T Sentence Text: Handrails installed along aisle centre lines as required by Table 3.3.2.8A. shall, comply with Sentences 3.4.6.5.(3) to (5), (7) and (12), have gaps not less than 560 mm and not more than 915 mm wide, measured horizontally, at intervals not exceeding five rows of seats, comply with Sentence 3.4.6.5.(11) at terminations and required gaps, and have an intermediate rail located 305 mm below the principal handrail.

National Sentence Text: Aisles in a Group A, Division 4 occupancy shall (a) be located so that there are not more than 20 seats between any seat and the nearest aisle, and (b) be not less than 1?200 mm wide, except that an aisle serving less than 60 persons is permitted to be 750 mm wide.
P/T Sentence Text: Aisles in a Group A, Division 4 occupancy, (a) shall be located so that there are not more than 20 seats between any seat and the nearest aisle, and (b) shall be not less than 1 200 mm wide, except that an aisle serving less than 60 persons is permitted to be 750 mm wide.

National Sentence Text: If the vertical distance between seating platforms in bleachers is more than 280 mm, an intermediate step shall be provided the full width of the aisle and proportioned to provide 2 equal risers between platforms.
P/T Sentence Text: If the vertical distance between seating platforms in bleachers is more than 280 mm, an intermediate step shall be provided the full width of the aisle and proportioned to provide two equal risers between platforms.

National Sentence Text: If the vertical distance between seating platforms in bleachers is more than 450 mm, 2 intermediate steps shall be provided the full width of the aisle so that there are 3 equal risers between platforms.
P/T Sentence Text: If the vertical distance between seating platforms in bleachers is more than 450 mm, two intermediate steps shall be provided the full width of the aisle so that there are three equal risers between platforms.

National Sentence Text: If the passageway between rows of seats is not a closed deck, footboards shall be provided so that the total width of the footboards shall be not less than three quarters of the centre-to-centre spacing between rows of seats, and the spacing between footboard members shall be not more than 25 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: The capacity of a means of egress for a Group A, Division 4 occupancy shall conform to the requirements of Sentence 3.4.3.2.(3).

National Sentence Text: Openings above footboards and below the seats in rows of bleacher seats shall be provided with intermediate construction so that there is no opening that would permit the passage of a sphere of more than 100 mm in diameter.
P/T Sentence Text: Openings above footboards and below the seats in rows of bleachers shall be of a size that will prevent the passage of a sphere having a diameter more than 100 mm.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.2.13.(2), a library book storage room that is not normally accessible to the public shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h if it is more than 250 m2 in area, or contains book stacks that are more than 10 m high, or penetrate more than one floor assembly.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence (2), a library book storage room that is not normally accessible to the public shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h if it, is more than 250 m2 in area, or contains book stacks that, are more than 10 m high, or penetrate more than one floor assembly.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.2.13.(2), a library book storage room that is not normally accessible to the public shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h if it is more than 250 m2 in area, or contains book stacks that are more than 10 m high, or penetrate more than one floor assembly.
P/T Sentence Text: A Group A, Division 4 occupancy and each tier or balcony that has a capacity of more than, 1 000 persons shall have no fewer than three separate exits, or 4 000 persons shall have no fewer than four separate exits.

National Sentence Text: The fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.2.13.(1) is not required if the book storage room is sprinklered.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire separation required by Sentence (1) is not required if the book storage room is sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: Open book shelves are permitted above and below a mezzanine floor in a library building provided the height of the shelves is not more than 2.1 m but not more than 75% of the floor-to-ceiling height of the space above or below the mezzanine floor assembly.
P/T Sentence Text: If the vertical distance between seating platforms in bleachers is more than 450 mm, two intermediate steps shall be provided the full width of the aisle so that there are three equal risers between platforms.

National Sentence Text: A stage for theatrical performances and ancillary spaces, including workshops, dressing rooms and storage areas, shall be sprinklered.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence (2), a library book storage room that is not normally accessible to the public shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h if it, is more than 250 m2 in area, or contains book stacks that, are more than 10 m high, or penetrate more than one floor assembly.

National Sentence Text: A fire separation with a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h shall be provided between a stage for theatrical performances and ancillary spaces, including workshops, dressing rooms and storage areas.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire separation required by Sentence (1) is not required if the book storage room is sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.2.14.(6), a stage for theatrical performances and ancillary spaces, including workshops, dressing rooms and storage areas, shall be separated from the seating area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, except for a proscenium opening protected with a sprinkler deluge system conforming to the requirements of NFPA 13-2013 Installation of Sprinkler Systems an unframed fire curtain if the opening is not more than 20 m wide, or a semi-rigid fire curtain if the opening is more than 20 m wide.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence (6), a stage for theatrical performances and ancillary spaces, including workshops, dressing rooms and storage areas, shall be separated from the seating area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, except for a proscenium opening protected with, a sprinkler deluge system conforming to the requirements of NFPA 13 "Installation of Sprinkler Systems", an unframed fire curtain if the opening is not more than 20 m wide, or a semi-rigid fire curtain if the opening is more than 20 m wide.

National Sentence Text: A fire curtain required by Sentence 3.3.2.14.(3) shall be of a type acceptable to the authority having jurisdiction and designed to close (a) automatically upon the actuation of the sprinkler system, (b) automatically upon actuation of the fire alarm system, and (c) manually by remote control devices located at the curtain control panel and at each side of the stage.
P/T Sentence Text: A fire curtain required by Sentence (3) shall be of a type designed to close, (a) automatically upon the actuation of the sprinkler system, (b) automatically upon actuation of the fire alarm system, (c) manually by remote control devices located at the curtain control panel and at each side of the stage, and (d) automatically by heat-actuated devices.

National Sentence Text: At least 2 vents for the purpose of venting fire and smoke to the outside of a building shall be provided above a stage designed for theatrical performances and shall (a) have an aggregate area not less than one eighth of the area of the stage behind the proscenium opening, and (b) be arranged to open automatically upon actuation of the sprinkler system.
P/T Sentence Text: At least two vents for the purpose of venting fire and smoke to the outside of a building shall be provided above a stage designed for theatrical performances and shall, (a) have an aggregate area not less than one-eighth of the area of the stage behind the proscenium opening, and (b) be arranged to open automatically upon actuation of the sprinkler system.

National Sentence Text: The fire separation referred to in Sentence 3.3.2.14.(3) is not required between a stage and a seating area in a building that is sprinklered throughout, provided a sprinkler deluge system is installed at the boundary between the stage and the seating area.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire separation referred to in Sentence (3) is not required between a stage and a seating area in a floor area that is sprinklered, provided a sprinkler deluge system is installed at the boundary between the stage and the seating area.

National Sentence Text: In a Group A, Division 2 occupancy used for the serving of food and beverages, an interior flight of stairs with fewer than 3 risers is permitted provided it (a) is not less than 900 mm wide, (b) is illuminated at all times that occupants are on the premises, and (c) has a handrail on each side.
P/T Sentence Text: In a Group A, Division 2 occupancy used for the serving of food and beverages, an interior flight with fewer than three risers is permitted provided it, (a) is not less than 900 mm wide, (b) is illuminated at all times that occupants are on the premises, and (c) has a handrail on each side.

National Sentence Text: Where storage rooms are required by Part 4 of Division B of the NFC for the storage of flammable liquids or combustible liquids in assembly occupancies, such rooms shall not be located above or below the first storey.
P/T Sentence Text: A room intended for the storage of flammable liquids or combustible liquids required by the Fire Code made under the Fire Protection and Prevention Act, 1997 shall not be located above or below the first storey of the building.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.2.2.(2), the seating area of a Group A, Division 1 occupancy shall be separated from adjacent occupancies in the floor area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h if the occupant load in the seating area exceeds 200.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence (2), the seating area of a Group A, Division 1 occupancy shall be separated from adjacent occupancies in the floor area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h if the occupant load in the seating area exceeds 200.

National Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.2.2.(1) is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by part 3. is permitted to be less than 1 h for the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence (1) is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. is permitted to be less than 1 h for, the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.

National Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.2.2.(1) is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by part 3. is permitted to be less than 1 h for the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence (1) is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. is permitted to be less than 1 h for, the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.

National Sentence Text: If usable space exists under tiers of seats in arena-type buildings, a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min shall be provided between the space and the seats or the space shall be sprinklered.
P/T Sentence Text: If usable space exists under tiers of seats in arena type buildings, a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min shall be provided between the space and the seats or the space shall be sprinklered.

National Sentence Text: Except for the requirements of Article 3.3.2.8. for bench-type seats and except as required or permitted by Sentence 3.3.2.4.(2) and Articles 3.3.2.11. and 3.3.2.12., fixed seats in places of assembly shall be attached or secured to the floor, platform or platform riser, provided with arms and back, and arranged in rows having an unobstructed passage not less than 400 mm wide measured horizontally between plumb lines from the backs of the seats in one row and the edges of the furthest forward projection of the seats in the next row in the unoccupied position.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for the requirements of Article 3.3.2.7. for bench-type seats and except as required or permitted by Sentence (2) and Articles 3.3.2.9. and 3.3.2.10., fixed seats in places of assembly shall be, attached or secured to the floor, platform or platform riser, provided with arms and back, and arranged in rows having an unobstructed passage not less than 400 mm wide measured horizontally between plumb lines from the backs of the seats in one row and the edges of the furthest forward projection of the seats in the next row in the unoccupied position.

National Sentence Text: For fixed seats with backs and with folding tablet arms, the value of 400 mm required by Sentence 3.3.2.4.(1) shall be measured when the tablet arms are in the use position, but is permitted to be measured in the stored position provided there are not more than 7 seats between any seat and the nearest aisle, the seats are located in a lecture hall or an auditorium used for instructional purposes, and the tablet arm, when raised manually to a vertical position, falls by the force of gravity to the stored position.
P/T Sentence Text: For fixed seats with backs and with folding tablet arms, the value of 400 mm required by Clause (1)(c) shall be measured when the tablet arms are in the use position, but is permitted to be measured in the stored position provided, there are not more than seven seats between any seat and the nearest aisle, the seats are located in a lecture hall or an auditorium used for instructional purposes, and the tablet arm, when raised manually to a vertical position, falls by the force of gravity to the stored position.
